page.title: 11Medical Care for Laggan
page.content: The practice of the Laggan Doctor must be,in area, one of the largest in the National Health Service. The nearest hospital is Raigmore at Inverness 60 miles away.The nearest ambulance is in Kingussie 12 miles distant. The doctor has his surgery at home, having 9 surgery sessions per week. In a day of house calls he can travel distances of over 270km. In winter his practice becomes an outpost hospital when road conditions prevent travel to hospital. We must travel 12 miles to Kingussie for prescriptions. When there is no transport, medicines are sent by post. In urgent cases the doctor will have a supply of small drugs at the surgery. The Dentist's surgery is in Kingussie. From Newtonmore we have the service of a district nurse, health visitor and chiropodist. An optician from Inverness attends once a month.
